intro: Trachyspermum reginei, commonly known as Persian cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are widely used as a spice in various cuisines. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a branched stem that grows upright. The leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
